At that time, Bodhisattva Priyankara addressed the Buddha, saying: World-Honored One! Are there any
bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas in this assembly who have attained this samÄdhi, as well as the eighty-four thousandğŸ”½pÄramitÄs,
dhÄraá¹‡Ä« gateways, and samÄdhi gateways?
The Buddha told Priyankara:
In this assembly, there are bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who have attained this samÄdhi and are also able to enter the eighty-four thousand pÄramitÄs, samÄdhis, and dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s.
These bodhisattvas will all attain anuttarÄ-samyak-saá¹ƒbodhi during the Bhadrakalpa;
except for the four tathÄgatas who have already attained buddhahood in this kalpa.
Bodhisattva Priyankara again addressed the Buddha, saying:

Please have compassion and proclaim the names of these bodhisattvas, which will greatly benefit and bring peace to the world, benefiting gods and humans, protecting the Buddha's teachings so that they may long endure, and revealing the Dharma gateway for future bodhisattvas, so that their minds will not become weary in seeking the unsurpassed path.
The Buddha told Joyful King:
You should now listen attentively!
Think about it well!
I will explain it for you.
Yes, World-Honored One!
I joyfully wish to listen.
At that time, the World-Honored One spoke the names of the buddhas in verse:

Homage to Buddha Jewel Superior Next, pay homage to the great canon of the twelve divisions of the Buddhist canon.
Respectfully bow to the great bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas of the ten directions.
Take refuge in the immeasurable and boundless great bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas of the worlds in the ten directions.
Respectfully bow to the Å›rÄvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and all the sages.
Take refuge in the immeasurable and boundless pratyekabuddhas.
Having paid homage to the Three Jewels, we next repent.
Disciples!

We respectfully request the Buddhas of the ten directions, the scriptures of the twelve divisions, all sages and saints, the eight groups of spiritual beings, the sentient beings of the Dharma realm, and the great assembly present to bear witness.
Disciples!
From beginningless time until now, we have committed countless grave offenses. Today, with utmost sincerity, we confess and repent, and take refuge in the Buddha.

Homage to the Buddha of Eastern Direction who Makes Precepts, Homage to the Buddha of Southern Direction who is Most Courageous, Homage to the Buddha of Western Direction who is Unimpeded in Renown, Homage to the Buddha of Northern Direction who has the Virtue of Dragon Flowers, Homage to the Buddha of South-eastern Direction who has Boundless Power of Freedom, Homage to the Buddha of South-western Direction who is Precious and Self-Sovereign, Homage to the Buddha of North-western Direction who is Lotus and Self-Sovereign, Homage to the Buddha of North-eastern Direction who is Sumeru and NÄrÄyaá¹‡a, Homage to the Buddha of Lower Direction who Establishes Diligence, Homage to the Buddha of Upper Direction who is Lapis Lazuli Light and Most Abundant. I take refuge in the Three Jewels in the ten directions and throughout the entire space of the cosmos.
Disciples!

From beginningless kalpas up to this present body, we have killed all the Three Jewels, teachers, monks, parents, relatives, good and virtuous friends, and sentient beings in the Dharma realm, an incalculable number;
Stealing all the property of the Three Jewels, teachers, monks, parents, six relations, and friends in the Dharma realm, the number is incalculable;

Giving rise to wrong thoughts towards all the Three Jewels, teachers, monks, parents, six relations, and friends in the Dharma realm, the number is incalculable;ğŸ”½Lying and deceiving all the Three Jewels, teachers, monks, parents, six relations, and friends in the Dharma realm, the number is incalculable;ğŸ”½Frivolous speech teasing all the Three Jewels, teachers, monks, parents, six relations, and friends in the Dharma realm, the number is incalculable;
Harsh speech scolding, slandering, and disparaging all the Three Jewels, teachers, monks, parents, six relations, and friends in the Dharma realm, the number is incalculable;

Slandering and causing discord, destroying all the Three Jewels, teachers, monks, parents, six kinds of relatives, good friends, and sentient beings in the Dharma realm, the number of which cannot be known;

Or breaking the five precepts, eight precepts, ten precepts, ten wholesome precepts, two hundred and fifty precepts, five hundred precepts, the three categories of bodhisattva precepts, ten inexhaustible precepts, and all precepts and all dignified precepts, the number of which cannot be known, whether done by oneself, instructed to others, or rejoiced in seeing others do them.

Such offenses are also like the boundless and innumerable subtle dust motes of the lands in the ten directions. The offenses we have committed are also boundless and innumerable. The bounds of space are boundless, and the offenses we have committed are also boundless. The bounds of skillful means are boundless, and the offenses we have committed are also boundless. The bounds of the nature of dharmas are boundless, and the offenses we have committed are also boundless. The bounds of the dharma realm are boundless, and the offenses we have committed are also boundless. The bounds of sentient beings are boundless, and the plundering and killing we have done are also boundless. The bounds of the Three Jewels are boundless, and the offenses we have committed against them are also boundless. The bounds of the precepts are boundless, and the offenses we have committed against them are also boundless.

Offenses such as these, even the bodhisattvas above and the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas below are unable to know them. Only the Buddhas, together with the Buddhas, are able to know the extent of our offenses.

Now, before the Three Jewels and before the sentient beings of the Dharma realm, we confess and repent, not daring to conceal them. We only pray that the Three Jewels of the ten directions and the sentient beings of the Dharma realm will listen to our repentance.
Disciples!

From beginningless kalpas until now, due to various evil deeds, we have experienced great sorrow and suffering, poverty and hardship, anxiety and fear, and have always been timid and fearful in all places. We have never had even temporary joy and happiness.

The great compassionate World-Honored Ones in the present ten directions are able to remove all the fears of sentient beings. We pray that they accept our sincere repentance. We now repent of all past evils and confess our present misdeeds with a sincere mind.

As for what we have not yet done, we dare not do it again. As for what we have already done, we dare not conceal it. We now repent of the three kinds of physical karma, the four kinds of verbal karma, and the three kinds of mental karma.
The various difficulties of birth and death, the difficulties of various desires and afflictions, we now repent of all these difficulties.

The difficulty of a restless mind, the difficulty of associating with bad friends, the difficulties of the three realms of existence, and the difficulties of the three poisons, the difficulty of encountering difficulties, the difficulty of meeting a good time, the difficulty of cultivating merit, and the difficulty of encountering the Buddha,
We now repent of all these difficulties.
Disciples!
Now, for all sentient beings and for our own bodies, we take refuge and repent before the Buddhas of the ten directions.

All sentient beings, for immeasurable eons, do not recognize the Buddhas or the kindness of their parents, do not understand good dharmas, and create all kinds of evil. Relying on their own birth, family, and various riches and treasures, they indulge in licentiousness in their prime and commit all kinds of evil deeds. Their minds think unwholesome thoughts and their mouths engage in evil actions, and they do not see the faults they create according to their minds.

Ordinary foolish beings, ignorant and shrouded in darkness, associate with bad friends, their minds disturbed by afflictions. For the sake of the five desires, their minds give rise to anger and resentment. Not knowing contentment, they create various evils. Associating with non-sages, they give rise to stinginess and jealousy. Due to poverty, they engage in deceit and create evil. Bound by others, they are always fearful. Lacking self-mastery, they create various evils. Greed, anger, and delusion agitate their minds. Oppressed by thirst and craving, they create various evils. Relying on clothing, food, and women, the bonds and afflictions of desire arise. Their minds are attached to the love of other men.

Or they give rise to the notion of a woman towards cows, horses, donkeys, mules, sheep, and all kinds of birds and beasts. Not following the Buddha's teachings, they create various evils. The three karmas accumulated by body, speech, and mind - in this way, all these offenses are immeasurable and boundless. We now repent of them all.
Disciples!
From beginningless time until today, we may have been disrespectful to the Buddha, Dharma, and the noble Sangha, and thus committed various offenses.
We now repent of all these offenses.

We may have slandered the true Dharma due to lack of wisdom, not knowing to respect our parents and elders, and being covered by delusion, arrogance, and indulgence. We have committed various evils due to greed, anger, and delusion, and thus committed immeasurable and boundless offenses. We now repent of all these offenses with a sincere mind.

We may have enjoyed drinking alcohol without moderation, or given alcohol to the Sangha, to those who uphold the precepts, to bhikshunis, to those who have extinguished their minds, or to those in meditation. We now repent of all these offenses with a sincere mind.

May the disciples, by inheriting the merit generated from repenting like this, wish to forever abandon the womb and take form according to their wishes, to be reborn with the power of the six spiritual penetrations, to rescue and embrace all suffering beings, and to have their vows extend as far as the reaches of space and the Dharma realm. May all beings in the hells, hungry ghosts, poverty and distress, and those suffering from afflictions all have their sufferings eliminated.
Moreover, may the disciples,

by inheriting the merit generated from repenting like this, wish to depart from birth and death and reach the other shore of great wisdom, to turn the unsurpassed wheel of subtle and pure Dharma, and to fully accomplish all their vows and aspirations.

Moreover, may the blind see, the deaf hear, the mute speak, the naked be clothed, the poor and destitute obtain treasure troves, with granaries overflowing and nothing lacking, and may all experience peace and happiness, such that not a single person suffers.

May sentient beings look at each other with a compassionate mind and the eyes of a Buddha, with an upright and dignified appearance that people delight in seeing, adorned with the most excellent form and appearance, becoming true good and wise advisors for the bodhi family.
The Sutra of the Questions and Answers of the Bodhisattva of the Lotus Treasure on Karmic Retribution, Scroll 1. Baota previously entered a flying fire screaming splitting head hell.

The hell was sixty yojanas long and wide, surrounded by iron walls and covered with an iron net above. Iron spikes as sharp as swords were inside, and a fierce wind blew the fire with blazing smoke burning the sinners.
At that time, in the eastern gate, there were thirty-six thousand sinners who cried out, saying:
What sins have we committed to come into this place?

The horse-headed rakshasa held an iron cudgel and struck their backs, and as the sinners entered, he kicked them with his feet. The sinners staggered and fell down step by step, and the iron spikes stabbed upwards, with flying fire burning them, either starting from the eyes or coming out of the mouth.
The sinners cried out and ran east and west, but if they ran east, the flying fire burned them in reverse, and if they ran west, the fire still burned their faces.

The horse-headed rÄká¹£asa grabbed the sinners' hair with his hands and threw them down, their skin and fur all fell off and their bodies and bones were shattered. Then there were hungry dogs that came to eat their flesh, and hungry ghosts that came to drink their blood.

In a single day and night, they experienced ten thousand kinds of suffering. They could not seek life, nor could they seek death. For countless kalpas, they received retribution without end. Later, if they were able to escape, they would always become animals.
Baota asked the horse-headed rÄká¹£asa:
What sins did these people commit that led them to enter this place?
The horse-headed rÄká¹£asa replied:

These sinners received the Buddha's precepts but did not uphold them. They plucked the fur of birds and beasts and harmed all kinds of beings without ever having any kindness or thoughtfulness. Those who were captured had their spirits fly away and their souls run and scatter. The pain was unbearable and the suffering was difficult to endure.
Yet those people pull out the feathers and feathers of the birds, considering it joyful, without any compassion or shame. Because of these offenses, they fall into this hell.
Bodhisattva Baodala heard this, wept sorrowfully, and left.
